name: Boo Cupcakes
description: This is a fun, cost-effective, and family-friendly baking craft to get your kids ready for Halloween!
preparation: Lightly brush Muffin Makers with oil.
In a large bowl, with an electric mixer, beat cake mix with egg, milk, oil, and vanilla for 2 min on medium. Gently stir in boiling water until smooth (batter will be thin).
Divide batter evenly into pans, filling cavities about 3⁄4 full.
In two batches, microwave on high for 2 min 30 sec. Rest in pan 5 min; invert onto wire rack to cool. Or, bake in preheated 350° F oven 15–18 min. Cool in pan 10 min, then unmold.
Meanwhile, in a 4-cup, microwavable bowl, microwave candy melts on high for 60–90 sec or until melted, stirring every 30 seconds.
Spoon small dollop of melted chocolate onto each baked cupcake and top with a marshmallow.
Divide remaining melted chocolate onto top of each marshmallow—use a generous amount so it oozes down the sides. Place two chocolate chips on the front of each marshmallow to make eyes.
tips: Instead of chocolate chips, use candy eyeballs for an extra spooky ghost! If you can’t find them in the baking section of your grocery store, try a craft shop.

products.name: Chocolate Cake Mix (Pack of 2)
summary: Oh, baby! This is the stuff: Moist, fluffy, gluten free chocolate cake that’s unbelievably decadent. Elevate birthday parties, Friday date nights, weekend dinners with a cake that everyone will ask you to bake over and over again – for real, it’s that good! Best of all? It’s ready in less than 10 mins in the microwave.

products.name: Muffin Maker (Set of 2)
summary: Make perfect portions of your favourite sweet or savoury cupcakes, muffins, frittatas, meatloaves, & more!
